an5.34:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.
an5.34:1.2: Then General Sīha went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and asked him,
an5.34:1.3: “Sir, can you point out a fruit of giving that’s apparent in the present life?”
an5.34:2.2: “A giver, a donor is dear and beloved to many people.
an5.34:2.3: This is a fruit of giving that’s apparent in the present life.
an5.34:3.1: Furthermore, true persons associate with a giver.
an5.34:3.2: This is another fruit of giving that’s apparent in the present life.
an5.34:4.1: Furthermore, a giver gains a good reputation.
an5.34:4.2: This is another fruit of giving that’s apparent in the present life.
an5.34:5.1: Furthermore, a giver enters any kind of assembly bold and assured, whether it’s an assembly of aristocrats, brahmins, householders, or ascetics.
an5.34:5.2: This is another fruit of giving that’s apparent in the present life.
an5.34:6.1: Furthermore, when a giver’s body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
an5.34:6.2: This is a fruit of giving to do with lives to come.”
an5.34:7.1: When he said this, General Sīha said to the Buddha,
an5.34:7.2: “When it comes to those four fruits of giving that are apparent in the present life, I don’t have to rely on faith in the Buddha, for I know them too.
an5.34:7.3: I’m a giver, a donor, and am dear and beloved to many people.
an5.34:7.4: I’m a giver, and true persons associate with me.
an5.34:7.5: I’m a giver, and I have this good reputation: ‘General Sīha gives, serves, and attends on the Saṅgha.’
an5.34:7.6: I’m a giver, and I enter any kind of assembly bold and assured, whether it’s an assembly of aristocrats, brahmins, householders, or ascetics.
an5.34:7.7: When it comes to these four fruits of giving that are apparent in the present life, I don’t have to rely on faith in the Buddha, for I know them too.
an5.34:7.9: ‘When a giver’s body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.’ I don’t know this, so I have to rely on faith in the Buddha.”
an5.34:7.10: “That’s so true, Sīha! That’s so true!
an5.34:7.11: When a giver’s body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
an5.34:8.1: Giving, you’re loved and befriended by many people.
an5.34:8.2: You get a good reputation, and your fame grows.
an5.34:8.3: A generous man enters an assembly
an5.34:9.1: So an astute person, seeking happiness, <j>would give gifts,
an5.34:9.2: having driven out the stain of stinginess.
an5.34:9.3: They live long in the heaven of the Three and Thirty,
an5.34:9.4: enjoying the company of the gods.
an5.34:10.1: Having taken the opportunity to do good, <j>when they pass from here
an5.34:10.2: they wander radiant in the Garden of Delight.
an5.34:10.3: There they delight, rejoice, and enjoy themselves,
an5.34:10.4: provided with the five kinds of sensual stimulation.
an5.34:10.5: Having practiced the word of the unattached, <j>the poised,
an5.34:10.6: disciples of the Holy One rejoice in heaven.”
